date_type.title:
===== Type-specific options =====
 These use string values that correspond to Hub enum names (lowercase, without prefix)
 e.g., "issued", "created" for date_type; "doi", "isbn" for identifier_type
date_type.description: ===== Type-specific options ===== These use string values that correspond to Hub enum names (lowercase, without prefix) e.g., "issued", "created" for date_type; "doi", "isbn" for identifier_type  For dates: the semantic date type (issued, created, captured, copyright, modified, etc.)

identifier_type.description: For identifiers: the identifier type (doi, url, handle, isbn, issn, orcid, etc.)

subject_vocabulary.description: For subjects: the vocabulary (lcsh, mesh, aat, fast, ddc, lcc, keywords, genre, local)

role.description: For contributors: the default role (author, editor, translator, etc.)

contributor_type.description: For contributors: the contributor type (person, organization)

relation_type.description: For relations: the relation type (member_of, part_of, version_of, references, etc.)

resource_type.description: For resource types: map to Hub ResourceTypeValue (article, book, thesis, etc.)

parser.title: ===== Parsing options =====
parser.description: ===== Parsing options =====  Parser to apply when reading this field Values: passthrough, edtf, iso8601, year, bibtex_name, csl_name, split,         strip_html, normalize_whitespace, doi, isbn, orcid, url, relator, custom

validators.title: ===== Validation options =====
validators.description: ===== Validation options =====  Validators to apply (comma-separated) Values: required, doi, isbn, issn, orcid, url, email, iso8601, edtf, year_range, pattern, length, range

min_count.title: ===== Cardinality options =====
min_count.description: ===== Cardinality options =====  Minimum number of values required

max_count.description: Maximum number of values allowed (-1 = unlimited)

serializer.title: ===== Serialization options =====
serializer.description: ===== Serialization options =====  Serializer to apply when writing this field Values: passthrough, edtf, iso8601, year, bibtex_name, csl_name, join, custom

xml_name.title: ===== XML serialization options =====
xml_name.description: ===== XML serialization options =====  XML element name (if different from proto field name)

xml_attr.description: Serialize as XML attribute instead of element

xml_chardata.description: XML character data (no element wrapper, just the value)

xml_omit.description: Omit this field from XML output

rdf_predicate.title: ===== Metadata =====
rdf_predicate.description: ===== Metadata =====  RDF predicate this field corresponds to (e.g., "dcterms:title")

omit_empty.description: Whether this field should be omitted if empty

required.description: Whether this is a required field

priority.description: Priority when multiple sources map to same target (higher = preferred)

FieldOptions.title: Field Options
FieldOptions.description: FieldOptions defines how a spoke field maps to the Hub schema.
